sorular.soru: Can you turn left here?
cevaplar: Yes, you can turn left here.
You can turn both left and right here.
No, you can only turn right here.
sorular.dogruCevap: No, you can only turn right here.

feedback.metin: You are approaching a one-way street, which is closed to drivers in the direction other than what the arrow indicates. Turning right here is therefore mandatory.

sorular.soru: Which traffic category does this road user fall into?

feedback.metin: This road user falls under the pedestrian traffic category. This road user is not driving a vehicle and is not a handler. A dog does not belong to the category of horses or livestock.

sorular.soru: Can you also drive a motorcycle with a driving licence for passenger cars?

feedback.metin: You must obtain a separate driving licence for a motorcycle. To be allowed to drive a motorcycle, you must have driving licence A.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to enter this road while towing the red vehicle?

feedback.metin: A towed vehicle falls under the category of trailers. The sign shows that this road is closed for motor vehicles with trailers. You are not allowed to drive here.

sorular.soru: Should you indicate if you want to leave this lay-by?

feedback.metin: Driving away from a lay-by along the road is a special manoeuvre. You must indicate your direction of travel, regardless of whether any traffic is approaching at that moment.

sorular.soru: What should you do in this situation?
cevaplar: Slow down, use light signals, and drive carefully onto the verge.
Sound your horn, use light signals, and drive carefully onto the verge.
Use light signals and enter the other side of the road.
sorular.dogruCevap: Slow down, use light signals, and drive carefully onto the verge.

feedback.metin: If an overtaking, oncoming vehicle has misjudged a manoeuvre, warn them using light signals. Brake as much as possible in your own lane and, if necessary, steer onto the verge at low speed.

sorular.soru: What lights should you use when you are waiting in the dark on a carriageway outside a built-up area?

feedback.metin: Drivers of a motor vehicle with more than two wheels must use sidelights and rear lights when they are stationary on a carriageway outside built-up areas. This applies both during the day when visibility is seriously obstructed and at night.

sorular.soru: Do you have to give right of way to the pedestrian?
cevaplar: No. Because there is no pedestrian crossing.
Yes. Because the pedestrian is on the same road travelling straight on.
No. Pedestrians never have right of way.
sorular.dogruCevap: Yes. Because the pedestrian is on the same road travelling straight on.

feedback.metin: The pedestrian is travelling in the opposite direction to you. You want to turn off, while the pedestrian wants to continue straight on. If you turn off, you must give right of way to all traffic travelling straight on, including pedestrians.

sorular.soru: What should you do if this light comes on?
cevaplar: Stop immediately and call the breakdown service.
Stop in a safe place and check the lighting.
Nothing. It means you have switched the lights on.
sorular.dogruCevap: Stop in a safe place and check the lighting.

feedback.metin: This light means that there is a defect in the lighting. You do not have to stop right away, but find a safe place and stop there, for example, in a car park. Check the lighting for broken lamps and replace them if possible. Always ensure you have spare bulbs available. If you cannot replace the bulb yourself, have it replaced at a garage as soon as possible.

sorular.soru: In which scenario does the cyclist have right of way over you?

feedback.metin: While road signs take precedence over traffic rules, this is only true for traffic rules that apply to exactly the same situation. The priority triangles indicate that you should give right of way to drivers on the intersecting road. However, the cyclist is travelling on the same road as you. The presence of priority triangles is not relevant. The ‘through traffic has priority over traffic turning off the same road’ remains valid here, which is why the cyclist has right of way over you in both scenarios.

sorular.soru: Should you expect speed pedelecs on this carriageway?

feedback.metin: Speed pedelec riders are subject to the same rules as moped riders. Speed pedelec riders use the cycle/moped path, and when this path is not present, they use the carriageway. They are not allowed to use cycle paths. In this case, there is no cycle/moped path, but only a cycle path. Therefore, speed pedelec riders must use the carriageway.

sorular.soru: What can the police take a saliva test for?

feedback.metin: The police can take a saliva test if they suspect drug use. If the test reveals that the driver may have used drugs, a blood test is carried out at the police station.

sorular.soru: When is it only allowed to overtake on the right instead of the left?
cevaplar: Just before or on a roundabout.
If the driver in front of you wants to turn left.
sorular.dogruCevap: If the driver in front of you wants to turn left.

feedback.metin: If the driver in front of you has indicated that he or she wants to turn left and is therefore pre-sorted on the carriageway, you may only drive past him or her on the right-hand side. In this situation, it is prohibited and life-threatening to overtake on the left. A tram may be overtaken on the left or right, depending on where there is space. Both left and right overtaking is allowed just before and on a roundabout.

sorular.soru: Is the break-away cable attached to the car correctly?

feedback.metin: The break-away cable should never be hung loose over the tow bar but must be attached to a designated eye or hook. That is the case in this example, so this cable is properly attached.

sorular.soru: You want to go straight ahead. Do you have to give way to the motorcyclist?

feedback.metin: You do not have to give way to the motorcyclist. The motorcyclist and you are on the same road. The motorcyclist wants to turn off and you go straight ahead. Through traffic on the same road goes before traffic turning off.

sorular.soru: What lighting do you use in a tunnel during the day?

feedback.metin: In a tunnel, you must always use dipped headlights. Both during the day and at night.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to drive with a broken exhaust?
cevaplar: Yes. But only if the exhaust does not make too much noise.
Yes. But only if your engine does not get too hot as a result.
No. You may never drive with a broken exhaust.
sorular.dogruCevap: No. You may never drive with a broken exhaust.

feedback.metin: If your exhaust is broken, you are not allowed to drive the vehicle. A broken exhaust will produce a lot of unnecessary noise, and parts of your exhaust may end up on the road. Moreover, an array of dangerous gases can be released. Always make sure you have a well-maintained vehicle.

sorular.soru: What should you do before you start driving?
cevaplar: You must make the whole vehicle snow-free.
You only need to make the windscreen and front side windows free of snow.
You must make all windows snow-free.
sorular.dogruCevap: You must make the whole vehicle snow-free.

feedback.metin: You must make the whole vehicle snow-free. According to law, you must have a clear view through the windscreen and front side windows next to the driver. Also, the lights and number plate must be clearly visible. In addition, you may not endanger other traffic by pieces of snow and ice that blow off your vehicle while driving.

sorular.soru: How high may a passenger car be including a load?

feedback.metin: A passenger car including a load may have a maximum height of 4 metres.

sorular.soru: Are you positioned properly?

feedback.metin: You can wait like this to improve the flow of traffic. This is only allowed if you are not blocking other traffic flows, posing any danger, or causing hinder.

sorular.soru: Is a recommended speed indicated here?

feedback.metin: A speed limit is indicated here. In this case the A-1 sign is placed on a coloured background to make it stand out. A recommended speed is indicated by a square blue sign with white numbers.

sorular.soru: What risk do you run here?
cevaplar: That you cannot see traffic approaching from the right.
That the vehicle in front of you rolls backwards against your vehicle.
That you cannot see when the traffic light turns green.
sorular.dogruCevap: That the vehicle in front of you rolls backwards against your vehicle.

feedback.metin: If you stop so close to another vehicle on a slope, you run the risk that the vehicle will first roll into your vehicle before driving away. It is always wise to keep a good distance from the vehicle in front of you, even when stationary. Not only in connection with the rolling back of the vehicle in front of you, but also so that you can pass this vehicle if it does not move forward due to a breakdown.

sorular.soru: Are you required to give this road user right of way when crossing the road?

feedback.metin: Blind people (recognisable by their white cane with red rings) crossing the road must be given right of way, even if there is no pedestrian crossing. This also applies to individuals with limited mobility, including people who use a walking stick, walker, or rollator, or similar. This does not apply to people using a wheelchair or disabled vehicle.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to stop here?

feedback.metin: Stopping or parking directly on or within 5 metres of a pedestrian crossing is prohibited.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to drive if the parking brake does not work properly?
cevaplar: Yes. But only if the other brakes do work.
Yes. A working parking brake is not mandatory.
No. The parking brake must always work properly.
sorular.dogruCevap: No. The parking brake must always work properly.

feedback.metin: A car must always be equipped with a properly functioning parking brake. If it does not work or does not work properly, you are not allowed to drive.

sorular.soru: What is the difference between summer and winter tyres?
cevaplar: A different tyre tread and tyre shape.
A different rubber compound and tyre tread pattern.
A different rubber compound and tyre shape.
sorular.dogruCevap: A different rubber compound and tyre tread pattern.

feedback.metin: The composition of the rubber is different for winter tyres than for summer tyres. When it is cold, the rubber of a summer tyre becomes hard. The rubber of a winter tyre remains soft at low temperatures, so you keep a better grip. The tread of a winter tyre is also different and has a pattern which provides maximum grip on snow. Please note that the tread depth of the primary grooves of a winter tyre must be at least 4 mm.

sorular.soru: Is it safe to merge here at 60 km/h?

feedback.metin: Merging safely means merging at the speed being driven on the main carriageway. You can see from the hectometre sign and the presence of a hard shoulder that you are entering a motorway where other traffic is travelling at about 100 to 130 km/h. There are no traffic jams. If you merge at too low a speed, this can be dangerous for other drivers. Although merging at 60 km/h is not prohibited, it is unsafe in this situation.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to overtake the motorcycle on the right?

feedback.metin: You can overtake on the left or right immediately before as well as on a roundabout.

sorular.soru: Can you still be a novice driver at age 36?

feedback.metin: Everyone obtaining their licence for the first time, is a novice driver for at least 5 years. It does not matter how old you are. Even at age 36, you can still be a novice driver if you obtained it after age 31.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to overtake on Tuesdays at 9:30 a.m.?

feedback.metin: Overtaking within the times indicated on the sign is prohibited only for lorries. This sign does not apply to you.

sorular.soru: Are you parked correctly?

feedback.metin: You must not obstruct or endanger other traffic. It is almost impossible for other traffic to pass between you and the other car, which is prohibited.

sorular.soru: How do you correctly use a safety hammer?
cevaplar: By striking in the middle of the windscreen.
By striking a corner of the side window.
By striking the bottom of the side window.
sorular.dogruCevap: By striking a corner of the side window.

feedback.metin: You should always try to smash a side window because the windscreen consists of laminated glass. This glass can break, but because of the film in between, the shards of glass remain stuck together. The weakest point of the side window is the corner. So use the steel point to hit the corner of the window with a strong force.

sorular.soru: Should you indicate when exiting a roundabout?

feedback.metin: Roundabouts are actually one-way streets with only right turns. When exiting a roundabout, you should always indicate right.

sorular.soru: Is this child being transported correctly?

feedback.metin: This child is not being transported safely because the headrest is adjusted too high. The top of the headrest must be level with the top of the child's head to best prevent head and neck injuries in the event of a collision. In addition to that, the child is wearing a thick winter coat. This reduces the effect of the seat belt.

sorular.soru: What qualifies as a very dense fog?

feedback.metin: Very dense fog occurs when visibility is less than 50 metres. From 50 to 100 metres, the fog is dense.

sorular.soru: Which sign indicates that you must always stop?

feedback.metin: Both signs mean: give right of way to drivers on the intersecting road. At the B-6 sign, you may continue if no crossing drivers are approaching. At the B-7 sign, you always must stop first.

sorular.soru: Is it recommended to replace the seat belts after a collision?

feedback.metin: The protective effect of a vehicle's seat belt deteriorates considerably if it has already provided protection in the event of an accident. Always have the seat belt replaced after an accident.

sorular.soru: Can you rollerblade here?
cevaplar: Yes, when rollerblading you can choose which section of the road to use.
No, rollerblading is not allowed on roads with no pavement, footpath, or cycle path.
Yes, but only if there is no pavement, footpath, cycle path, or moped path.
sorular.dogruCevap: Yes, but only if there is no pavement, footpath, cycle path, or moped path.

feedback.metin: Persons travelling by means of objects other than vehicles, such as rollerblades, a skateboard, or a scooter, must use the pavement or footpath, cycle path, or cycle/moped path. If none of these are present, they can use the carriageway.

sorular.soru: Should you stop here and wait for an opportunity to merge?

feedback.metin: You are not allowed to stop here. Drive slowly alongside the traffic jam and merge at the earliest possible opportunity.
